text: Stop hook fires after every Claude response (not session end) — throttle with a lock file (120s) to avoid spawning N sonnet processes in an N-turn session.

claude --resume resolves the session transcript from ~/.claude/projects/<cwd-hash>/<session_id>.jsonl — cwd-hash is derived from the cwd when the session was CREATED, not the hook event cwd. Fix: search ~/.claude/projects/*/<session_id>.jsonl and read cwd from first entry.
claude --resume needs the session's original cwd — search ~/.claude/projects/ for the transcript file and read cwd from its first entry [kg-architecture]
Use sys.executable (not hardcoded 'python') when installing hooks — ensures the Python with kg installed runs the hook. Same pattern as mg.

cwd for --resume: do NOT use data["cwd"] from hook event — it is the hook's cwd which may differ from the session's project root (e.g. kg is sub-project). Use _find_session_cwd(): glob ~/.claude/projects/*/<session_id>.jsonl, decode encoded dir name to get original cwd.
cwd for --resume: use data["cwd"] from the hook event directly — it IS the session project root. Do NOT read session JSONL files in the hook.

encoded project path uses lstrip and replace slashes with dashes; decode is lossy for paths with dashes in dir names but is_dir() check filters false positives
kg start creates <project>/.claude -> .kg symlink so Claude Code finds local settings inside the project dir [how-to-use-kg]
